title: John Wall says Gortat gets "the most spoon-fed baskets ever"
title_page: John Wall says Gortat gets "the most spoon-fed baskets ever"
maintext:
While appearing on ESPN Tuesday, John Wall was asked about a tweet his teammate Marcin Gortat wrote last week, and apparently, the point guard took it personally.
â€œSC6â€ host Michael Smith interviewed the injured Wall and asked him what he thought of an apparently sarcastic comment Gortat wrote, calling the Washington Wizardsâ€™ Feb. 1 win over Toronto without Wall a great â€œteamâ€ victory.
â€œIt was more just shock to hear it from him, understanding he gets the most assists from me and the most spoon-fed baskets ever,â€ Wall said.
Unbelievable win tonight ! Great â€œteamâ€ victory! Marcin GortatğŸ‡µğŸ‡± (@MGortat) February 2, 2018
The Wizards won their first five games after Wall had to have knee surgery, including against the Raptors on Feb. 1, when eight Wizards players scored in double figures in a 122-119 win.
NBA Advanced Stats found Wallâ€™s comment about Gortatâ€™s scoring tendencies to be true in this sense: 28.7 percent of the Polish centerâ€™s points this year came off assists from Wall, the highest percentage of anyone on the team.
It was reported yesterday (before this interview) that Washington was interested in trading Gortat.
For what itâ€™s worth, Gortat told reporters Tuesday that that tweet was not meant to be a sarcastic jab about the teamâ€™s success in Wallâ€™s absence, and that he thought he had cleared it up privately with Wall already.
â€œHe felt it was a different way and he came back with that kind of comment,â€ Gortat said. â€œSo, now we got to ask each other questions whoâ€™s attacking who?â€
In the midst of the melodrama, the Wizardsâ€™ winning streak was snapped when they lost 115-102 in Philadelphia. They return home to face the Boston Celtics on Thursday.
